definition[0]: to become weaker or less certain
example[1]: The studentsâ€™ attention did not waver.
example[2]: Harris never wavered in his loyalty.
example[3]: We were determined not to waver from our goals.
definition[1]: to not make a decision because you have doubts
example[4]: Shareholders who were wavering met the directors.
example[5]: The party wavered between free trade and protectionism.
definition[2]: to move gently in several different directions
example[6]: The candle flame wavered, throwing shadows on the wall.
